text: Paolo Fabbri (17 April 1939 – 2 June 2020) was an Italian semiotician and professor. He was born in Rimini, Kingdom of Italy. Fabbri taught at the Italian Cultural Institute in Paris from 1992 to 1996. He also taught at the University of Florence, the University of Urbino, the University of Palermo, the School for Advanced Studies in the Social Sciences, and the Collège international de philosophie. Fabbri died on 2 June 2020 in Rimini, aged 81. ==References== Category:Italian educators Category:People from Rimini Category:1939 births Category:2020 deaths
